thread.title: Obama renews call for gun control debate: 'I am not resigned'

author: FoxNews.com
title: Obama renews call for gun control debate: 'I am not resigned'
text:
Published June 19, 2015 FoxNews.com
President Obama said Friday that it is “not good enough to simply show sympathy” for the victims of mass shootings, and called for a sense of urgency in restricting access to guns.
Obama, speaking to the U.S. Conference of Mayors in San Francisco two days after the church shootings in South Carolina that killed nine, clarified comments he made on the tragedy Thursday.
He said they were misinterpreted by some as showing he was resigned to inaction on gun control.
“I want to be clear, I am not resigned,” Obama said. “I have faith we will eventually do the right thing. I was simply making the point that we have to move public opinion. We have to feel a sense of urgency. Ultimately Congress will follow the people. “
However, Obama conceded that “serious gun control legislation” was unlikely in the current political climate. The president also warned that debate on the issue must not demonize law-abiding gun owners, nor should it be suggested that merely having a debate is a “wild-eyed plot to take everybody’s guns away.”
Obama told the conference he couldn't say that the gun control legislation he pushed unsuccessfully earlier in his tenure would have stopped the Charleston shootings, "but we might still have more Americans with us."
"You all might have had to attend fewer funerals," he told the mayors.
Obama praised actions by mayors from both parties around the country on issues such as the minimum wage, family leave and broader access to preschool as evidence that changes at the local level can make a difference in areas where Congress has declined to advance his priorities. He also urged the mayors to help advance his trade agenda, which has come up against stiff resistance from some Democrats in Congress.
The Associated Press contributed to this report.
